definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
one of the characters used in kwukyel (phonetic "ra"), an ancient Korean writing system
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations

sentences.english: The crowd was disappointed about the lack of enthusiam from the players.
sentences.chinese: 一些缺乏激情的選手們令觀衆大失所望。

sentences.english: I love it most , making me calm and quiet.
sentences.chinese: 此生最愛的東西，我愛她到狂熱，她卻令我心靜。

sentences.english: Four hours on the tennis court fagged me out.
sentences.chinese: 在網球場上的四個小時令我精疲力盡語源。

sentences.english: As time gose by, man is making the earth sike .
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的推移，人類正在令地球受到破壞。

sentences.english: I was gratified at the attendance to my talk, and the enthusiastic response.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆對我的發言予以熱烈的響應，令我深感榮幸。

sentences.english: The community's electronic eye has left the thieves nowhere to hide.
sentences.chinese: 社區電子眼，令小偷小摸無處遁形。

sentences.english: Anna's constant search for new ideas and challenges keeps her ahead of her times.
sentences.chinese: 對新理念與挑戰的不斷追求令安娜始終走在時代前列。

sentences.english: This is a unique opportunity to get a progressive politician to be the president of the council.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個令進步政治家成爲理事會主席得大好機會。

sentences.english: To his surprise, the new neighbor is his primary school.
sentences.chinese: 令他驚訝的是，這個新鄰居竟然是他的小學同學。

sentences.english: He had seen no daily paper all week, and, strangely to him, felt no desire to see one.
sentences.chinese: 他已經一週沒看報，令他奇怪的是，也並不想看。

sentences.english: To my amazement, he was able to recite the poem from memory.
sentences.chinese: 令我大爲驚奇的是，他把這首詩從頭到尾背了出來。

sentences.english: Restore luster to the skin, the beauty parlor every week or self-massage time.
sentences.chinese: 令肌膚恢復光澤，每週可以到美容院或自行按摩一次。

sentences.english: The interior of a Leather Tanner's workshop can make strong men retch.
sentences.chinese: 製革工坊內部的惡臭令壯漢亦不禁窒息。

sentences.english: That swindle soured a great many potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 那種行騙行爲令許多想去投資的人慾往而止。

sentences.english: The reasonable color combination can make your beautiful eyes more charming and attractive.
sentences.chinese: 合理的色彩組合，令雙眼嫵媚動人。

sentences.english: Your job is just to figure out how to make it fun and interesting.
sentences.chinese: 你的工作就是找到令它們有趣兒的方法。

definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
sufficient to.../so much so that/so that
